Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Which one of the following statement is true?
options: Temperatures differing 25° on the fahrenheit (F) scale must differ by 45° on the celsius (C) scale
Temperatures which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the Fahrenheit scale
Water at 90°C is warmer than water at 202°F
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Temperatures which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the Fahrenheit scale
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: By the relation in different temperature scales (C-0)/5 = (F-32)/9 = (K-273)/5 = (R-0)/4. We can calculate that temperature which differ by 10° on the celsius scale must differ by 18° on the fahrenheit scale.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Why are inner lining of hot water geysers made up of copper?
options: Copper does not react with steam
Copper is good conductor of both heat and electricity
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Copper is good conductor of both heat and electricity
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Copper is a good conductor of both heat an electricity due to this it is used in all such appliance where quick heat transfer is required.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: A diffraction pattern is obtained using a beam of red light. Which one among the following will be the outcome, if the red light is replaced by blue light?
options: Diffraction pattern becomes broader and further apart
Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together
Physics (Optics).answer: Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together
Physics (Optics).explanation: Diffraction pattern becomes narrower and crowded together.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: As the sunlight passes through the atmosphere, the rays are scattered by tiny particles of dust, pollen, soot and other minute particulate matters present there. However, when we look up, the sky appears blue during mid-day because
options: ultraviolet and yellow component of sunlight combine
Physics (Optics).explanation: As, scattering µ 1/λ⁴. Since, wavelength of blue colour is least among three primary colours red, green and blue, so violet colour scattered most. The scattered light in the sky contains blue colour in plenty and therefore sky appears blue.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Raw mangoes shrivel when pickled in brine. The phenomenon is associated with
options: increase of surface tension of fluid
decrease of surface tension of fluid
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Raw mangoes shrivel when pickled in brine due to osmosis i.e. flow of water from higher concentration to lower concentration through a semi-permeable membrane.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: The apparent weight of a steel sphere immersed in various liquids is measured using a spring balance. The greatest reading is obtained for the liquid
options: in which the sphere was submerged deepest
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: When a body immersed in a liquid, then the apparent weight of the body depends upon the densities of the liquids and volume of the portion of the solid immersed in liquid. So, the apparent weight of a steel sphere will be greatest for the liquid with the smallest density.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: The angle of contact of water with glass is acute while that of mercury with glass is obtuse
The angle of contact of water with glass is obtuse, while that of mercury with glass is acute
Both the angle of contact of water with glass and that of mercury with glass are acute
Physics (Properties of Matter).answer: The angle of contact of water with glass is acute while that of mercury with glass is obtuse
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: For ordinary water and glass it is about 8° (acute angle) and for mercury and glass it is about 135° (obtuse angle).

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: If an object having mass of 1 kg is subjected to a force of 1 N it moves with
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: As we know, F = ma or a = F/m. \ a = 1N/1kg = 1 m/s2

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: An athlete diving off a high springboard can perform a variety of exercises in the air before entering the water below. Which one of the following parameters will remain constant during the fall?
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: When a athlete jumps from the spring board, he curls his body by rolling his arms and legs in. By doing so, he decreases moment of inertia of his body and hence angular speed increases to conserve the angular momentum, as I₁w₁ = I₂w₂ = constant.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The pressure exerted on the ground by a man is greatest
options: when the lies down in the ground
when the stands on the toes of one foot
when the stands with both foot flat on the ground
all of the above yield the same pressure
Physics (Mechanics).answer: when the stands on the toes of one foot
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Pressure is normal force per unit area, therefore, for lesser value of area pressure is greatest.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A passenger in a moving train tosses a five rupee coin. If the coin falls behind him, then the train must be moving with a uniform
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: As the passenger tosses the coin, it goes up and is in motion with the initial speed of the train but if the train is accelerated, so its speed increases. But the coin is in the air with initial speed of train, so the train slightly moves forward from the coin with the person and coin falls behind him. It happens when train is moving with accelerated motion.

Physics (Oscillations & Waves).subject: Physics (Oscillations & Waves)
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).question: The force acting on a particle executing simple harmonic motion is
options: directly proportional to the displacement and is directed away from the mean position
inversely proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
directly proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
inversely proportional to the displacement and is directed away from the mean position
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).answer: directly proportional to the displacement and is directed towards the mean position
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).explanation: The restoring force acting on the particle is always proportional to the displacement of the particle from the equilibrium position and is always directed towards the equilibrium position.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one of the following reducing agents can also act as an oxidising agent?
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
SO2 can act as an oxidising agent as well as a reducing agent.
It oxidises H2S to S
2H2S + SO2 —> 2H2O + S
It reduces ferric sulphate to ferrous sulphate
Fe2(SO4)3 + SO2 + 2H2O —> 2FeSO4 + 2H2SO4

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one among the following has been producing/can produce light by a chemical change?
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
In a chemical change a new substance is formed. Sun has been producing light by nuclear fusion and it is a chemical change.
4 11H —> 24He + 2 +10e + g + Energy

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: The law enforcement agencies use a chemical test to approximate a person's blood alcohol level. The person undergoing the test blows into the mouthpiece of a bag containing sodium dichromate solution in acidic medium. A chemical reaction with ethanol changes the colour of the solution from
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: On reaction with ethanol the colour of the solution changes from, orange to green.

Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).subject: Chemistry (Materials & Alloys)
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).question:
Consider the following statements regarding the properties and uses of glass wool.
I. Glass wool has tensile strength greater than steel.
II. Glass wool is fire proof.
III. Glass wool has high electrical conductivity and absorbs moisture.
IV. Glass wool is used to prepare fibre glass.
Which of the statements given above are correct?
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).explanation: Glass wool is an insulating material, obtained from fibre glass arranged into a texture similar to wool.

Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).subject: Chemistry (Materials & Alloys)
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).question:
Statement I : During the setting of cement, the structure has to be cooled by spraying water.
Statement II : The constituents of cement undergo hydration during setting of cement and it is an exothermic reaction.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true.
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).explanation: During the setting of cement, the structure has to be cooled by spraying water because setting of cement is an exothermic process and involves hydration of calcium aluminates and calcium silicates.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: A woman desires to clean the surface of her gold ornaments by a chemical approach. For this she requires to use
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Aqua-regia is a mixture of concentrated nitric acid and concentrated hydrochloric acid in the ratio of 1 : 3. It is a very powerful oxidising mixture and hence, used to clean the surface of gold ornaments.

Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry)
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).question:
Statement I: Superphosphate of lime can be assimilated by plants.
Statement II: Superphosphate of lime is soluble in water.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true.
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).explanation: Superphosphate of lime can be easily assimilated by plants because it is soluble in water.

Chemistry (General Concepts).subject: Chemistry (General Concepts)
Chemistry (General Concepts).question: Which one of the following is not a periodic property i.e., does not show any trend on moving from one side to the other in the periodic table?
Chemistry (General Concepts).explanation: Radioactivity is not a periodic property. It is a nuclear property. Atomic size, valency and electronegativity are periodic properties because they show a trend on moving from one side to the other in the periodic table.

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: Scuba divers are at risk due to high concentration of dissolved gases while breathing air at high pressure under water. The tanks used by Scuba divers are filled with
options: a mixture of N2 and helium
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: The tanks used by Scuba divers are filled with air diluted with helium (i.e., He-O2 mixture) because unlike nitrogen, helium is not soluble in blood even under high pressure.

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: Which among the following are the most important raw materials for the manufacturing of soap?
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: The major raw materials for soap production are fat and alkali. Other materials like water, softner, perfume, etc, may also be mixed if required.

Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry)
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).question: Which one of the following is not needed in a nuclear fission reactor?
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).explanation:
Substances like graphite and heavy water are used as moderator to slow down the speed of neutrons. Cd or B are used as control rods to control rate of fission by absorbing neutrons.
Coolant like heavy water or molten sodium is used to carry away the heat.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Chemically silk fibres are predominantly
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Silk fibres consist of protein like wool. It is produced by pupa of silk insect.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which among the following is the correct increasing order of pH found in human body?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: The pH of gastric juice is not more than 4.5 pH of saliva is 6-7.4, whereas the pH of blood is equal to 7.4

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question:
Match the following
List-I (Sugar)
A. Cellulose
B. Fructose
C. Maltose
D. Sucrose
List-II (Source)
1 Honey
2 Sugarcane
3 Cotton wool
4 Starch
Codes:
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Cotton wool is acquired from cotton plant. It consists of cellulose. Fructose is fruit sugar present in honey and other fruits. Starch is a polysaccharide. It breaks down into maltose during digestion whereas sucrose is common sugar. It is a disaccharide having glucose ans fructose and is acquired from sugarcane.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Mosquito can be a vector for the following disease except
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Kala-azar is spread by sandfly of genus phlebotomus argentipse of yellow fever and dengue fever is spread by Ades mosquito whereas filariasis is spread by Anopheles mosquito.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: What is the most conspicuous salient feature of people with 'Progeria'?
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Progeria (pro means prior; geria means ageing) causes early ageing and the death of child occurs at the age of 12-13 years. It is a progressive genetic disease and created due to the mutation in the LMNA gene.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question:
Consider the following statements
1. Warm-blooded animals can remain active in cold environment in which cold-blooded animals can hardly move.
2. Cold-blooded animals require much less energy to survive than warm-blooded animals.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
Biology (Zoology).explanation: The warm blooded animals produce heat by converting their food to energy and maintain a constant body temperature thus may be active even in cold environment whereas cold blooded animals hibernate and need much less energy to survive.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Cattle are capable of digesting cellulose present in the grass and/or fodder that they eat. This ability is attributed to the
options: presence of cellulose degrading bacteria in the rumen
production of cellulose by the cattle rumen
prolonged retention of cellulose in the rumen
Biology (Zoology).answer: presence of cellulose degrading bacteria in the rumen
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Mammalian digestive system do not secrete enzymes to digest cellulose, but the cellulose digesting bacteria present in the rumen of cattles can digest the cellulose existing in fodder.

Biology (Human Health).subject: Biology (Human Health)
Biology (Human Health).question: A deficiency of which one of the following minerals is most likely to lead to an immunodeficiency?
Biology (Human Health).explanation: The deficiency of calcium can cause irritability, anger tendency and impaired immune function.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Human body's main organ of balance is located in
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The internal ear of human beings consists of three parts viz. cochlea, utricle and sacculus The cochlea helps in hearing whereas utricle and sacculus help to maintain the body balance.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question:
Which of the following statements correctly describe the properties of hormones?
1. They are steroids, proteins, peptides or amino acids derivatives.
2. They are not produced by body organs and are mostly taken as supplements.
3. They do not influence the working of those organs which have secreted them.
4. They act as co-enzymes and help enzymes to perform their function.
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The hormones are secreted by endocrine glands of body. They can behave as coenzymes, e.g., thiamine pyrophosphate can help in the transfer of aldehye group. Enzymes can be protein or steroid in composition.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one among the following animal tissues transport hormones and heat and maintains water balance?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Blood is a fluid connective tissue. It carries harmones from endocrine glands to target organs. It carries heat and set homeostasis. It also aids in osmoregulation by carrying fluid to the kidney and skin, etc.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question:
Which among the following statement about biofertilizers are correct?
1. Azotobacter is one of the nitrogen fixing bacteria used as a biofertilizer.
2. They have to be applied to the leaves of the plant only.
3. They alter the chemical composition of the soil.
4. They can be used along with organic fertilizers.
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Biology (Botany).explanation: Azotobactor and Rhizobium are known as nitrogen flxing bacteria that are utilized as biofertilizers. The biofertilizers can be applied with organic fertilizers.

Biology (Nutrition).subject: Biology (Nutrition)
Biology (Nutrition).question: Why are pregnant women recommended substantial intake of green leafy vegetables in their diet, especially in the 1st trimester?
options: They are a rich source of chlorophyll
They are a rich source of lecithin
They are a rich source of folic acid which is required for DNA synthesis
They are a rich source of essential fatty acids required for cell anabolism
Biology (Nutrition).answer: They are a rich source of folic acid which is required for DNA synthesis
Biology (Nutrition).explanation: A pregnant woman requires an additional 400mg of folic acid daily during the first trimester of pregnancy. Green vegetables are rich in folic acid because they have folate.
